chapter.title: Working With Media
chapter.para: The following sections describe how to&dbpi; relevant parameters for output media. The following actions are supported in the Media view:

sect1.title: Defining a Medium
sect1.para: You can define a new medium. You can configure the desired properties directly in the overview table.
Proceed as follows to create a new medium.

step.para: Switch to the Media view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Create
(Create).

result.para: A new entry with empty fields is created in the overview table. The ID, Weight and Thickness fields contain mandatory information and are therefore highlighted in red (marked as incorrect) while they do not contain valid values.

step.para: Enter a name for the new Medium in the ID field.
In the Name field, enter an additional descriptive name for the medium as required.
In the Weight field, use the arrow keys to select the maximum weight of a sheet (in milligrams) or type the appropriate value directly into the text field.
In the Thickness field, use the arrow keys to specify the maximum number of times a single sheet can be folded (number of layers).

Click Save button
(Save) to save the new medium and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the new medium is displayed in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel the creation of the medium and exit the editing mode without saving the medium.

sect1.title: Listing Media
sect1.para: You can display an overview of the configured media in the workspace of the Media view.
The overview table displays the following information for each configured medium by default:

listitem.para: The unique identifier of the medium (user defined paper type ID).
Detailed description of the paper type definition.
Sheet weight (in mg) The paper weight is used for the calculation of the weight of the mail piece.
Sheet size. This information is currently not evaluated.
Thickness of the sheet. This information is e.g. used for postage optimization.

sect1.title: Displaying Medium Details
sect1.para: You can display the details for a specific medium in the details pane. Compared to the overview table the details pane contains more information.

mediaobject.alt: Paper Sizes view with details pane

sect1.para: The following information is currently available in the details pane for media.

listitem.para: The unique identifier of the medium (user defined paper type ID).
Currently, only the value media is supported.
Sheet weight (in mg) The paper weight is used for the calculation of the weight of the mail piece.
Sheet size. This information is currently not evaluated.
Thickness of the sheet. This information is e.g. used for postage optimization.

sect1.title: Editing a Medium
sect1.para: You can modify the media properties.

note.para: Please keep in mind that you cannot use this action to modify the unique identifier of the medium. To modify the medium ID, create a new medium with the desired ID (see ).

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the values of an existing medium:

step.para: Switch to the Media view.
Double-click the desired row in the overview table.

result.para: The entry switches to editing mode.

step.para: Enter a name for the new medium in the Name field.
In the Weight field, use the arrow keys to select the maximum weight of a sheet (in milligrams) or type the appropriate value directly into the text field.
In the Thickness field, use the arrow keys to specify the maximum number of times a single sheet can be folded (number of layers).

Click Save button
(Save) to save the medium with the new values and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the medium is displayed with the new values in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel the creation of the medium and exit the editing mode without saving the changes.

sect1.title: Modifying Multiple Media
sect1.para: You can edit selected values for multiple media in one step.

note.para: Please keep in mind that with this function, you define the same values for all selected media.

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the settings of the selected media.

step.para: Switch to the Media view.
Select at least two media entries from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Icon Edit
(Edit).
Tick the checkbox in front of each value you want to change for all selected media.
In the Process field, specify the process to which all selected media should be linked.
In the Name field, specify the desired name for all selected media.
In the Weight field, specify the maximum weight of a sheet (in milligrams).
In the Size field, specify the size of a sheet.
In the Thickness field, specify the maximum number of times a single sheet can be folded (number of layers).
Click OK to save the changed settings for all selected media and close the dialog.

result.para: The changed settings for the selected media are displayed in the overview table and in the details pane.

step.para: Click Cancel to close the dialog without changing the settings.

sect1.title: Deleting Media
sect1.para: Use this action to delete a single medium or multiple media. Proceed as follows to delete existing media.

step.para: Switch to the Media view.
Select at least one medium from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Delete
(Delete).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Delete Media opens.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Delete Media, click OK to delete the selected medium (or media).
In the confirmation dialog Delete Media, click Cancel to close the dialog without deleting the selected medium (media).

result.para: If the media have been successfully deleted, a success message is displayed.
If the media could not be deleted, a corresponding error message is displayed.
